refnamediv.refpurpose: Return the number of result columns in a statement

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ocinumcols returns the number of columns in the statement stmt.

example.title: ocinumcols example
example.programlisting: \n"; $conn = OCILogon("scott", "tiger"); $stmt = OCIParse($conn, "select * from emp"); OCIExecute($stmt); while (OCIFetch($stmt)) { echo "\n"; $ncols = OCINumCols($stmt); for ($i = 1; $i <= $ncols; $i++) { $column_name = OCIColumnName($stmt, $i); $column_value = OCIResult($stmt, $i); echo $column_name . ': ' . $column_value . "\n"; } echo "\n"; } OCIFreeStatement($stmt); OCILogoff($conn); echo ""; ?>

note.para: This function was renamed to oci_num_fields after PHP >= 5.0.0. For downward compatibility ocinumcols can also be used. This is deprecated, however.
